config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration is used as a parameter when creating a PersistentJournal object in the journal() method. It is passed along with other parameters like _journalAgeThreshold, _journalDiskSync, journalSuffix(), and monitor() to initialize the PersistentJournal object.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _journalSizeThreshold configuration depends on the conditions specified in the if-else statement in the journal() method. If _transientMode is false, the configuration will be triggered whenever a new PersistentJournal object is created.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _journalSizeThreshold configuration option on the system is significant as it determines the size threshold for the journal. Setting a higher value for _journalSizeThreshold may result in larger journal files and potentially increased disk usage, while setting a lower value may lead to more frequent journal file creations and disk writes.
